page.title: 05Ramsden Telephone Exchange
page.content: Ramsden Telephone Exchange looks like public toilets because it is just a hut with windows. The workman let us go into the exchange to look around. Inside the air smelt of toothpaste. He showed us the wires. There was a line of numbers. He dialled the telephone exchange number "86". The eight and then six went on to the line of numbers. When the numbers moved they made a funny noise. He lifted the receiver and the noise stopped. It works by step by step switching.Each call travels through a series of switches containing a vertical rod with a horizontal contact arm. Magnets move the arm up and down a vertical rod of terminals which rotates horizontally. When you dial the arm moves to a terminal. When it touches the terminal the number is connected.
